page.title: 02Transport in Arundel
page.content: Arundel is on the main {railway}line from London to Portsmouth, with a branch line to Littlehampton. Arundel Station handles about 60 trains per day holding ca. 800 passengers in winter and ca.3000 in summer. The latter figure is mainly tourists, many foreign. There is an hourly train service to London. There are many goods trains carrying eg. oil,flowers, roadstone newspapers and the Orient Express. There is a 2-hourly express bus service between Portsmouth and Brighton in the area. The A27, the main {South Coast Trunk Road}runs through the area carrying heavy traffic of all descriptions bypassing the town centre of Arundel. The A284 runs North-South through the area from Littlehampton in the South towards London in the North. A system of small roads link Arundel with the villages.
